For `expert_suggests_timeslots` it contains link for providing alternative timeslots. For other call statuses it's blank.

info.description:
# Webhooks API:

Webhooks allow vendors to receive information from the ENS Navigator  E.g. when new workstream is created ENS Navigator will send webhook request to Expert networks.

During initial setup Expert Network should provide webhooks for accepting data from ENS Navigator.  Each webhook should check authorization

Required webhooks:
  - Webhook for accepting projects data.
  - Webhook for accepting workstreams data.
  - Webhook for accepting experts data.
  - Webhook for accepting calls data.

ENS Navigator team will provide signing key during initial setup. This token should be used for authorization checking.
Note:
In the documentation we provide example of endpoints that should be implemented on network side for handling webhooks.
During initial setup network should provide base url for webhooks. Individual webhook url constructed from base url with additional webhook path.
E.g. workstreams webhook url is <base_webhooks_url> + /workstreams.

## Synchronous or asynchronous flows

Expert Network may handle webhooks synchronously or asynchronously. For synchronous webhook Expert Network should send models ids back to ENS Navigator during webhook request. For asynchronous webhook Expert Network should use `message_id` from webhook payload and send models ids to ENS Navigator on a later phase using rest api.

## Experts and calls webhooks

Experts and calls webhooks will be requested only if all network id fields are present in ENS Navigator (should be set before webhook).
For experts webhook required ids: `client_id`, `project_id`, `workstream_id`, `expert_id`
For calls webhooks required ids: `client_id`, `project_id`, `workstream_id`, `expert_id`.

# Rest API:

Our Rest API should be used for sending expert profiles to the McKinsey ENS Navigator.

## Authorization

Each request should contains `slug`, `timestamp`, `salt` and `signature` in HTTP Headers:

```
X-ENS-API-SLUG: {slug}
X-ENS-API-TIMESTAMP: {timestamp}
X-ENS-API-SALT: {salt}
X-ENS-API-SIGNATURE: {signature}
```

Slug is provided during initial setup.
Timestamp is unix-based/integer timestamp with millisecond precision.
Salt is randomly generated string for each request.
Signature calculated using this formula (+ means concatenation of strings):

```Ruby
signature = downcase(encode_base16(sha256_hmac(signing_key, slug + timestamp + salt)))
```

Request acceptor should verify signature using signing key, slug, timestamp and salt. If signatures are not the same then  401 Unauthorized status should be sent in response.

ENS Navigator team will provide signing key and slug during initial setup. This key should be used for authorization checking.

# CHANGELOG
<details><summary>open changelog details</summary>
## v9.7
- Added `in_compliance_review` flag in [calls webhook](#/webhooks/webhooks_calls)
</details>

post.description:
Expert network should send client, project ids when asynchronously handles project hook.

## Async flow
For asynchronous webhook Expert Network should use `message_id` from webhook payload and send models ids to ENS Navigator on a later phase using rest api.

parameters.name: X-ENS-API-SALT

parameters.description:
Signature calculated using this formula (+ means concatenation of strings):

```Ruby
signature = downcase(encode_base16(sha256_hmac(signing_key, slug + timestamp + salt)))
```
parameters.name: X-ENS-API-SIGNATURE

parameters.description: Slug is provided during initial setup.
parameters.name: X-ENS-API-SLUG

parameters.description: Timestamp is unix-based/integer timestamp with millisecond precision.
parameters.name: X-ENS-API-TIMESTAMP

parameters.description: Salt is randomly generated string for each request.
parameters.name: X-ENS-API-SALT

post.description:
ENS Navigator will use this webhooks for sending updates about projects.

## Sync flow response

```json
{
  "client_id": "<id>",
  "project_id": "<id>"
}
```

## Async flow response

```json
{
  "client_id": null,
  "project_id": null
}
```

post.description:
ENS Navigator will use this webhooks for sending updates about workstreams.

## Sync flow response

```json
{
  "workstream_id": "<id>",
  "client_id": "<id>",
  "project_id": "<id>"
}
```

## Async flow response

```json
{
  "workstream_id": null,
  "client_id": null,
  "project_id": null
}
```

parameters.description: Slug is provided during initial setup.
parameters.name: X-ENS-API-SLUG

parameters.description: Timestamp is unix-based/integer timestamp with millisecond precision.
parameters.name: X-ENS-API-TIMESTAMP

parameters.description: Salt is randomly generated string for each request.
parameters.name: X-ENS-API-SALT

parameters.description:
Signature calculated using this formula (+ means concatenation of strings):

```Ruby

```
parameters.name: X-ENS-API-SIGNATURE

post.description:
Expert network should send client, project and workstream ids when asynchronously handles workstream hook.

## Async flow
For asynchronous webhook Expert Network should use `message_id` from webhook payload and send models ids to ENS Navigator on a later phase using rest api.
